definition[0]: the fact of no longer having something, or of having less of it than you used to have, or the process by which this happens
example[0]: The company is closing down two of its factories, leading to 430 job losses.
example[2]: a type of hearing loss that affects language development
example[3]: The court awarded Ms Dixon £7,000 for damages and loss of earnings.
example[4]: a disease which causes fever and a loss of appetite
example[5]: This did not explain his apparent loss of interest in his wife.
example[6]: her loss of confidence in herself
example[7]: a certain feeling of loss of control
example[9]: The animal was weak through loss of blood.
definition[1]: if a business makes a loss, it spends more than it earns
example[10]: The company made a loss of $250,000 last year.
example[11]: The magazine’s losses totaled almost $5 million.
example[14]: Two of the mines are running at a loss.
example[15]: I’m sorry to hear of your family’s sad loss (=the death of someone you love).
example[16]: US forces withdrew after suffering heavy losses (=many deaths).
example[17]: The war has led to a tragic loss of life.
example[18]: She must be feeling very lonely after the loss of her husband.
definition[3]: a feeling of being sad or lonely because someone or something is not there anymore
example[19]: the deep sense of loss I felt after my divorce
definition[4]: a disadvantage caused by someone or something leaving or being removed
example[20]: We see your going as a great loss to the company.
definition[5]: the fact of no longer having something that you used to have, or having less of it
definition[6]: when a business spends more money than it receives in a particular period of time, or loses money in some other way
example[22]: The toy company blamed the losses on poor retail sales.
example[23]: The companymade a loss of £670,000 last year.
example[24]: British banks hit by heavy losses on bad loans
example[25]: There’s no reason for us to operate at a loss.
definition[7]: to lose money and make a record of this in the accounts
example[26]: The unit posted losses for the past two years, hurt by the economic slump.
definition[8]: an event that causes a person or organization to make a claim on an insurance contract
definition[9]: when a person or organization suffers or loses money because of the mistakes or NEGLIGENCE of another
